lines.gurmukhi: jYsy nrpiq binqw Anyk bRXwhq hY jw ky suq jnm h√çY qwNhI giH rwj hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Narapati Banitaa Anayk Byaahat Hai , Jaa Kay Sout Janam Hvai Taanhee Grih Raaj Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a king marries many women, but one who gives birth to a son is honoured with bestowing of kingdom.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy dD bohQ bhwie dyq chUM Er joeI pwr phuMcY pUrn sB kwj hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Dadh Bohad Bahaai Dayt Chahoon Aora , Joee Paar Pahounchai Pooran Sabh Kaaj Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as many ships sail in all directions of the sea, but one that reaches the shore beyond proves profitable.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Kwn Knq AnMq Knvwro KojY hIrw hwQ AwvY jw kY qwN ky bwju bwj hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Khaan Khanat Anant Khanavaaro Khojai , Heeraa Haad Aavai Jaa Kai Taan Kay Baaju Baaj Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as several mine diggers dig for diamonds, but one who finds a diamond enjoys the celebrations of his find.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisK nvqn Aau purwqn pY jwN pr kiRpw ktwC qwN kY Cib Cwj hY ]563]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gursikh Navatan Au Puraatan Pai , Jaan Par Kripaa Kataachh Taan Kai Chhabi Chhaaj Hai ?563?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, a Sikh of the Guru whether new or old devotee who gets a look of grace of the True Guru, earns honour, glory and praise.  (563)
